website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for small tile or glass cutting assignments that don't require extreme accuracy. Handy cordless tool to have around the shop for modifying pavers and tiles on the fly. Not as powerful as corded models.
pros: Cordless design means it can be taken directly to the project
Only weighs 4 pounds, including rechargeable battery
cons: Motor speed is on the slower side
Cutting jobs may take longer than expected

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw that gets the job done. Versatile unit can be used with wood or ceramics. Very easy control to cut strait line even over 8 foot rip. Great for tight fit areas. Drawback, 12 ft if 3/4” consumes 1/2 of a battery charge. Batteries recharge quickly. If you have 2 there is very little down time. You might want to buy a 4 amp as a backup if you don’t have a recharge ability at your work sight.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Perry

product_meta.title: Makita CC02R1 12V MAX CXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Tile/Glass Saw Kit, 3-3/8"
product_meta.description: Style:KitThe Makita 12V max CXT Lithium-Ion Cordless 3-3/8” Tile/Glass Saw Kit (CC02R1) delivers smooth and powerful cutting, with a compact design that’s engineered for ease-of-use and maneuverability. The kit includes two 12V max CXT Lithium-Ion slide-style batteries for improved balance and ergonomics over pod-style batteries. For added convenience the batteries include an on-board L.E.D. charge level indicator.
feature_bullets: Makita-built motor delivers 1,600 RPM for faster and powerful cutting
3-3/8" blade delivers a maximum cutting depth of 1" for a wide range of cutting applications
Compact and ergonomic design at only 12-3/8" long
Weighs only 4.0 lbs. with battery for reduced operator fatigue
Nickel-plated base prevents rust and tilts from 0° to 45° for bevel cuts
